title: Creating a Front Yard Garden to Engage the Community- Sustainable Living

tasks.task: Engage in community-based gardening and seed saving
subtasks: Clear and prepare garden space
Plant herbs for cooking and medicinal purposes
Propagate plants and create garden features (e.g., hedges, pathways)
Cultivate various fruit and vegetable plants suitable for local climate
Establish an herb garden near the front door for easy access
Implement permaculture principles to minimize water usage
Encourage community interaction and sharing through open garden stands
Practice seed saving for future crops
Engage in companion planting and use natural pest control methods (e.g., bird feeders)
Intersperse drought-tolerant flowers like roses to attract beneficial insects
Honor loved ones and cultural heritage through memorial plants (e.g., roses, aloe)

tasks.task: Learn and promote adaptive gardening practices
subtasks: Adapt gardening techniques for physical limitations (e.g., using a stool, ice pack)
Share gardening knowledge through teaching and community classes
Draw inspiration from environmental activists (e.g., Vandana Shiva) for advocacy
Emphasize the personal and social benefits of gardening (mental health, community building)

tasks.task: Practice environmental stewardship and community engagement
subtasks: Convert lawn areas into productive garden space
Create accessible garden features for all community members (e.g., wheelchair-accessible beds)
Foster a culture of sharing and resource exchange within the neighborhood
Use environmentally friendly pest control methods (e.g., attracting birds)
Protect garden from wildlife using natural methods (e.g., seeds for birds)

tasks.task: Honor cultural heritage through gardening traditions
subtasks: Preserve heirloom plants with historical significance (e.g., aloe from Middle Passage)
Commemorate family and friends through memorial garden plants
Engage in ancestral practices related to gardening and herbalism
